title: On well (edge) dominated and equimatchable strong product graphs
authors: Yixin Cao and Guiqiang Mou and Jianxin Wang
abstract:
A graph is well-(edge-)dominated if every minimal (edge) dominating set is
minimum. A graph is equimatchable if every maximal matching is maximum. We
study these concepts on strong product graphs. We fully characterize
well-edge-dominated and equimatchable strong product graphs of nontrivial
graphs, and identify a large family of graphs whose strong products with any
well-dominated graph are well-dominated.
